title: Drawing, "Sketchbook Page: Various Monuments in Bologna; Verso: Anatomical Study", 1811–14
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed: monumento/ de cinque/ cento/ Bologna.  Left bottom corner inscribed: 77. Verso, inscribed top left: Forli.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Three sides of pedestal with Renaissance decoration; trophy. Inscribed: monumento/ de cinque/ cento/ Bologna. Left side of sepulcra monument of cardinal, showing coat of arms and papal coat of arms which features a shield with three crescent moons stacked vertically.  Left bottom corner inscribed: 77. Verso: feet of man. Inscribed 8. At left, shaft and pedestal of fount with detailed view of pedestal and base. Inscribed top left: Forli.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketchbook Page: Various Monuments in Bologna; Verso: Anatomical Study", 1811–14.
1811–14. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2438.
